name: Camassia
description: Camassia, commonly known as Camas or Quamash, is a genus of six species of flowering plants in the family Asparagaceae, native to North America.These plants produce narrow linear leaves and striking blooms in spring and summer. The flowers are star-shaped with six petals that may be blue, purple or white, depending on the species. They are recognisable by their long stamens, giving them a magical look overall. They are gorgeous in beds and borders, but also good as cut flowers. Once planted, they will come back reliably year after year to brighten up your yard!
meaning: The genus name comes from the Nez Perce Indian name for this plant, and is based on the name “camas” or “quamash”, meaning “sweet”, in reference to the use of this plant as a food source for Native Americans.
color_description: The flowers are usually blue, purple and white, with attractive yellow stamens.
